speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we've got just about a minute before we go to the news. I understand we have Tom from Freemont on line one. [_presses button_] Go ahead, Tom.

speaker: Tom
text: [_v.o._] I don't want to be squeezed into a minute, I will go on after the news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, why don't you tell me your problem now and then I can give you my reply when we come back.

speaker: Tom
text: No, I'll wait.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well. [_presses button_] Roz, who else do we have?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Brian on a car phone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah! [_presses button_] Go ahead, Brian, I'm listening.

speaker: Brian
text: [_v.o._] For what?  Thirty seconds?!  I'll wait too!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, then.  I guess I'll just use the time myself. [_presses button and picks up a clipboard, he reads_] "Giddy up, giddy up, let's go" - to the Seattle Christmas Parade this Saturday, broadcast live on Channel 6 TV and hosted by Kelly Kirkland of Channel 6's Kelly and Carol Show.  You know, I must say that Kelly Kirkland is a real treasure.  She's sincere and charming and... well, just about as likeable as sunshine! [_smiles_] We'll be right back. [_presses button_]

speaker: Roz
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hm? Well, of course, why?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I was afraid with all that sucking up you might have burst a lung!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's very funny, Roz.  You see, Kelly's looking for a new co-host for the parade this year and I was hoping it might be me.  You know, I've watched that parade since I was a child and this is my chance to become a part of it.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I thought she did that parade with her husband.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I guess you haven't heard.  You see, she's discovered that Carol's been having an affair with her cue card girl. [_laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: How did she catch him? She find a giant love letter in his pocket?! _Frasier laughs.  Mary Thomas then enters the booth, the warm but loquacious woman from last season's "There's Something About Dr. Mary."  She is carrying three books._

speaker: Mary
text: Hey, Frasier, guess who?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Mary Thomas, oh.  Hello, Mary.  Roz, you remember Mary, she and I briefly co-hosted my show last year.

speaker: Roz
text: Of course, I remember.  I listen to your show on KEZW all the time.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, well, thank you so much and just for that, here's a copy of my new book and Frasier, here's one for you too.

speaker: Roz
text: [_reading cover_] "Warm Bread for the Soul" by Dr. Mary!

speaker: Frasier
text: I see you're still identifying yourself as a doctor.

speaker: Mary
text: But now it's true.  You read the inside cover.

speaker: Frasier
text: Eh? [_reads_] Dr. Mary has healed thousands of Seattle radio listeners and is a _summa cum laude_ graduate of the School of Hard Knocks.

speaker: Mary
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mary, I hate to quibble about things like accreditation and such...

speaker: Kenny
text: Woh, it's like the American Medical Association in here! [_laughs_] So, isn't this great? Dr.  Mary's coming back to KACL!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hey, congratulations!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, congratulations, indeed.  I... I must have missed that memo!

speaker: Kenny
text: Yes, she was doing so great in the ratings we had to steal her back.  Now, I thought your doctors took an oath not to hurt anybody, you are killing us!

speaker: Mary
text: [_laughs_] Oh, you.  You give me some sugar!

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, Frasier, I hope you're all right with this.  I know last time you weren't thrilled about us working together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, this time we'll have separate shows.  It's not like we're going to be sharing a mike! [_to Kenny_] Er, we won't be sharing a mike, will we?

speaker: Kenny
text: Of course not, we're giving Mary the morning drift shift.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering jealousy_] Oh, well, the shift with the biggest audience and the best demographics.

speaker: Mary
text: Don't you worry, I'll be promoting your show every single day.

speaker: Kenny
text: Is this woman not generous?!  Give me some sugar.

speaker: Mary
text: [_laughs_] No, baby, you've already got yours but here's a book for you. [_hands it over_] And Merry Christmas to all!

speaker: Kenny
text: [_emphatic_] Merry Christmas!

speaker: Roz
text: What the hell's wrong with you?!  _Kenny looks wistful as Roz exits to her booth.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier seems to have had his way once again this year as his home is aptly decorated in a stylish manner for Christmas.  Frasier answers the door to Niles who is holding a gift._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles. [_laughs_] I hope you had the presence of mind to bring presents of mine! [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: I haven't heard that line since last year!

speaker: Niles
text: But then again, Christmas is the season for chestnuts! [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: What's all the food for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, Kelly Kirkland's coming over, I'm trying to make a good impression.  You see, I was doing my best to charm my way into that parade job.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it with you and this parade?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, don't you remember when we were kids? We'd sit on the couch and cradle our cocoas and stay up late to watch our holiday hosts, Bob Vernon and Sergeant Michelle - the...

speaker: Both
text: ...traffic lady!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I haven't thought about them in years!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, to me, that was always the official beginning of Christmas and now this is my chance to usher in the season for a whole new generation.

speaker: Niles
text: I loved Sergeant Michelle! To this day, every time I cross against the light, I feel like I'm letting her down!

speaker: Niles
text: All right, what is that fetid smell?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, that's the food.  I'm preparing dishes that have been featured on Kelly's show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lord, that'll be my hobo casserole!

speaker: Niles
text: Hobo!  That's the smell! _Frasier exits to the kitchen.  Daphne enters from her room and notices Niles._ [_N.B. Jane Leeves' pregnancy is more covered in this episode, however her eating storyline is still being shown.  Daphne is seen to be eating food whenever she is on screen._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_stands and greets her_] Hello, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, where are we going for dinner tonight?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, er, it's your pick.  All though, word on the street has it that "Chez Du Mont" has the most delectable Hudson Valley foie gras.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, you're spoiling me!  All this rich food's gonna start catching up with my figure!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, not you my little hummingbird, never!

speaker: Daphne
text: You're as sweet as a chocolate souffle.  Let's get some of those, tonight.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's it!  I know I should have stocked my old Ballantines as soon as they stopped making it.  Now, I can't find a single can.

speaker: Martin
text: Christmas is ruined!

speaker: Daphne
text: Christmas is about more than beer, Mr. Crane!

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, and this year's extra special because Daphne and I are together.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's true. [_thinks_] No more Mel, no Maris, no Lilith... maybe I won't need beer this Christmas!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's Kelly.  Showtime!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Kelly.

speaker: Kelly
text: Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, you know, I haven't seen you since the "Broadcasters Against Litter" march!

speaker: Kelly
text: I think we really made a difference.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed we did.  Now, please, come on in.  I'd like you meet my brother, Niles, and his girlfriend, Daphne.

speaker: Kelly
text: Do I smell Hobo Casserole?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, close your eyes, it's like you're under a railroad bridge!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Yes, off you go.  _Frasier gives a stern look at Niles and Daphne who abruptly exits to Daphne's room._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you know about Hobo Casserole?

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, I make it on my show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I get so many of my recipes from your show that I've forgotten which are mine and which are yours!

speaker: Kelly
text: [_laughs, then sees bowl_] Ah, now don't tell me that's potato chip salad?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-oh, [_obvious acting_] this is embarrassing.

speaker: Kelly
text: So, you really are a fan of the show, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Guilty.  I especially admire your work on the Christmas Parade.

speaker: Kelly
text: You really want this, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Gosh, I do.  I really do.  I must admit.  In fact, you know, I'd be willing to audition for you right now.

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, Frasier, now that's not necessary.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, I'd like to.  Now, I've examined the parade schedule and I have taken a liberty of preparing a few ad-libs.  If you would indulge me in one or two?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Kelly.  Have you ever seen eighty beavers march in perfect rhythm?

speaker: Kelly
text: Oh, Frasier, everyone knows beavers can't march.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, they can, when they're the marching beavers of the Riverside High School Band!

speaker: Kelly
text: Hey, you tricked me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry, Kelly, but how about those incredible formations. They're so precise.

speaker: Kelly
text: Well, that doesn't surprise me, Fras, after all, the beaver is nature's first ENGINE-er!  [_laughs_]

speaker: Kelly
text: That's nice banter.  _Frasier looks gleeful.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Radio Station. Frasier is rounding up his show as Roz reads Dr.  Mary's book in her booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Seattle, thank you for your calls. _Frasier knocks on the window to Roz who is immersed in the book. She carries on reading._

speaker: Frasier
text: Seattle, thank you for your calls!

speaker: Roz
text: [_monotone and bored, still reading_] Hey, Frasier, what are you doing over the Christmas weekend?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz, if you insist on interrogating me, I'll be co- hosting the Seattle Christmas parade tomorrow night... _Roz begins nonchalantly ringing some Christmas bells whilst still reading.  She is obviously not too fussed about Frasier's plans for finishing the show._

speaker: Frasier
text: ...on Channel 6 with the lovely and talented Kelly Kirkland. I hope it will be the beginning of a new holiday tradition. Good mental health, see you at the parade.  _Frasier presses the button to go off-air.  Roz quickly throws down her bells and carries on reading.  Kenny enters._

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, doc.  Oh, Frasier, I wish you hadn't done that little promo.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?  Kelly told me I had the job, her word is good enough for me.

speaker: Kenny
text: I got some bad news.

speaker: Frasier
text: I knew I couldn't trust that woman, and after I had her to my home for that hillbilly buffet!

speaker: Kenny
text: She's got food poisoning.  She'll be laid up for days.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, a tough blow!  But, I'm nothing if not a team player, you know, I'll do the parade myself.

speaker: Kenny
text: Boy, you really know how to land on your feet, doc.  But, er, you're still going to have a co-host.  Listen, nothing officially yet, but there are a few names that are floating around.  _Frasier looks behind him and sees Mary jumping about happily with her co-workers.  She then looks at Frasier through the glass and indicates she will be working with him at the parade.  Frasier looks back to Kenny._

speaker: Kenny
text: I'll let you know if I hear anything.  _Kenny exits as Frasier grimaces.  End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is on the phone as Frasier enters who puts on his overcoat from the rack._

speaker: Martin
text: [_on phone_] Oh, that'd be sweet! [_pause_] No, it's Frasier. Okay, see you, Duke. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad, how do I look?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, a smile'd help!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sighs_] I know, it's just that this whole Mary thing's got me kinda upset.  You know, that woman grew up in Seattle, she's never even seen that parade, it's a sacrilege.  My God, you know, this event, it's an institution, it carries with it a tradition of pride and pageantry and old-fashioned good times. [_thinks_] Well, that's not bad, I think I might open with it.  _Niles and Daphne enter from her room.  Daphne carries a gift and places it under the tree._

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier, good luck tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thanks, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: We'll be watching.  Hey, maybe you could say hi to us on the air.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, for God's sake, Daphne, this is not some sort of a home movie!  This event carries with it a tradition of pride and pageantry and old-fashioned good times. [_thinks_] Eh, now I don't like it!  [_exits_]  _Daphne and Niles stand round Martin and begin their obviously practiced banter._

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe I'll heat up some cider for the parade.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, sounds good to me.  Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: I guess.  Parade just won't be the same without Ballantine.

speaker: Niles
text: Is anything the same to you without Ballantine?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure, lots of stuff. [_beat_] No, not really. _Niles gives Daphne a knowing glance before she quickly exits to the kitchen._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I know, Christmas is a few days off but Daphne and I were wondering if it wouldn't be a good idea for you to open one of your presents early.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, that'd be cheating.  No opening presents till Christmas morning.  _Daphne enters holding a gift-wrapped present, obviously a six-pack of beer._

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Martin
text: [_feels at it_] Who-ho-ho!  Well, I guess one wouldn't hurt. I'm not doing this by myself, though.  You two have got to open something too.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Daphne_] What do you think?

speaker: Daphne
text: One wouldn't hurt.

speaker: Niles
text: This is for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, and that's yours.

speaker: Martin
text: Everybody got something?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, good!

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] I knew it, thank you so much.  How'd you keep it cold?

speaker: Daphne
text: I hid it in the vegetable crisper.  I knew you'd never look there.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, they're exquisite.  Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: You're welcome. [_pause_] And you got me... [_unwraps, with enthusiasm_] ...batteries!  Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_let down_] Oh, you opened the wrong package. [_goes to tree_] You were supposed to open this one.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I can't open another one, that's not fair.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if we all open one more then it'd make it even.

speaker: Daphne
text: Sounds fair.

speaker: Niles
text: Alright, but that's it.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, no more.   **MARY CHRISTMAS**  _Scene Two - Christmas Parade. Frasier and Mary are on air, sat at their podium.  A fanfare of music is heard in the background._

speaker: Frasier
text: Merry Christmas, Seattle.  This is Dr.  Frasier Crane...

speaker: Mary
text: ...and Dr.  Mary!

speaker: Frasier
text: ...Welcoming you to the 42nd annual Christmas parade.

speaker: Mary
text: Yes, first off, we want to wish Kelly Kirkland a speedy recovery.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed, and may I say, it's an honor to be sitting here in the very chairs that were once occupied by the legendary Bob Vernon and his co-host Sergeant Michelle, who started this tradition so many years ago.

speaker: Mary
text: And here comes our first float, Frosty the Snowman!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Mary, historically speaking the first float was probably the Trojan horse.  It was a gift from the people of Troy.  Once brought inside the city walls however, they discovered it was filled with Greek soldiers, who slaughtered their Trojan enemies in the street.  Of course, modern floats have come a long way since then. [_with a grin_] We hope!

speaker: Mary
text: Well, this float comes to us as a gift from Seattle's sister city: Managua, Nicaragua.  You know, I like the way that sounds. [_with accent_] Managua Nicaragua. [_then_] It sounds like the name of a fine Latino man!

speaker: Mary
text: [_accent_] Would you like to dance, Dr.  Mary? [_then_] Yes, I would, Managua Nicaragua.  Shake that piece of Costa Rica for me! [_laughs_] For more information, here's float reporter Mike.

speaker: Director
text: And we're clear.

speaker: Mary
text: This is fun, isn't this fun?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, but you know, Mary, maybe we should try sticking to the script, hmm?  The more we improvise, the less professional we look.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, okay, I'm sorry now.

speaker: Director
text: Hey, Mary, great ad-libbing.  More of that.  Frasier, try to loosen up.  We're back in five! [_counts down_]  _CUT TO: Later.  We now see Frasier and Mary at the parade on the television at Frasier's apartment._

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, Mary, this enormous stocking is overstocked with presents!

speaker: Mary
text: Ooh, I'd like to tear into one of those gifts right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, not until Christmas morning, Mary.  You know, in my house, we don't even shake the boxes.  _The camera pulls back to show the household watching the television in the midst of much wrapping paper and opened presents.  Martin is sat in his fishing gear with an ear-flap hat on.  Daphne is decked out in skiing gear.  Niles is sat wearing his winter clothes reading a book.  They react to Frasier's comments._

speaker: Niles
text: We're going to need some wrapping paper.

speaker: Daphne
text: There's a couple of rolls in my room.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll get some tape.  _The three start about the task.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Christmas Parade. Frasier and Mary are continuing their "banter."  "We Wish You A Merry Christmas" plays behind them._

speaker: Frasier
text: This is the 5th float sponsored by a local software company.

speaker: Mary
text: Hey, those guys on that giant were knocked over by candy cane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Mary, [_showing her script_] and for a hundred and fifty feet, it certainly is the largest float on the parade.

speaker: Mary
text: Throw some candy canes over here!  [_shouts_] Come on, come on, put some muscle into it, you nerd!

speaker: Frasier
text: Mary...  _Suddenly, a barrage of candy suddenly engulfs Frasier, knocking his headset off._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smiling_] This might be a good time for a break.  We have an exciting surprise coming up - a special mystery guest.

speaker: Mary
text: [_suddenly, ad-libbed_] It's Santa!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Mary!

speaker: Director
text: And, we're clear!

speaker: Frasier
text: I think I'm gonna go get some air.

speaker: Mary
text: But we're outside.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stretch my legs!  _Frasier goes down from his podium to Roz, who is watching the parade with Alice._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier, thanks for the tickets.  Alice is having a great time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm glad somebody is.  Mary is ruining my parade.  Do you know, [_refers to his script_] this has been called "nice banter" by a top parade professional.  Does anybody get to hear it?  No.  Instead, Mary just prattles on endlessly as if every idea that pops into her head is worth saying out loud. She is totally unpredictable.  Now, Santa's coming up and I've prepared a really cute bit and I know she's going to ruin that too!

speaker: Roz
text: Look, if you tell her how important it is, I'm sure she'll back off.  She's a reasonable person.

speaker: Director
text: Fifteen seconds.

speaker: Roz
text: Good luck.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mary, listen, I've let you have free reign over the parade this evening, could I please do the Santa interview myself?

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, of course, of course.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.

speaker: Director
text: And cue.  _Frasier walks down to in front of the podium.  On air: "Santa Claus is Coming to Town" plays in the background._

speaker: Frasier
text: And we're back.  I see someone special getting off his sleigh.

speaker: Santa
text: [_enters_] Ho-ho-ho, ho-ho. [_to crowd_] Well, hello, up there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Some call him St.  Nick, others Kris Kringle, in Holland he's affectionately known as...

speaker: Santa
text: Oh, you must be Dr.  Mary.  You know, I've been meaning to call your show.  My elves always seem to get a little blue when the work is done, and I thought, well, maybe you could help.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, Santa.

speaker: Frasier
text: Santa, I've got some questions over here for you.

speaker: Mary
text: Maybe we all could put our heads together and come up with a solution.

speaker: Santa
text: [_to crowd_] Do you think that Dr.  Mary could help Santa to cheer up his elves?  [_they cheer_]

speaker: Mary
text: Why don't you give them some candy?

speaker: Santa
text: That's a great idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's a terrible idea.  Your elves are probably suffering from seasonal-affective disorder.  Now, loading them up with sweets will only aggravate the problem!

speaker: Santa
text: Kids love candy!  [_the crowd cheers_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Elves are not kids, they're tiny men!

speaker: Mary
text: Well, if you want my opinion...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thank you, Mary.  We've been listening to your opinions all night, and frankly there isn't enough room left in our heads for another one, now if you would just get back in... _Frasier puts his hands out and accidentally punches Santa on the nose with his microphone._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry.

speaker: Santa
text: What the hell's wrong with you?  Look, I'm bleeding, I'm bleeding.

speaker: Frasier
text: It was an accident.

speaker: Santa
text: I'm feeling dizzy.

speaker: Director
text: Cue the tape.  I don't care what tape, find something! Woman: What's wrong with you?  You attacked Santa Claus!

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, it was an accident.  Wasn't it, Mary?  You saw it.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, now, you want my opinion.  Honey, you're on your own.  _We FADE OUT.  Scene Three - Christmas Parade. The parade has ended and the place is empty.  Frasier walks up to Mary with a guilty look on his face._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Mary.

speaker: Mary
text: Hello.  Any word on Santa?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he'll be all right.  They gave him a coagulant.  I'd like to apologize for the way I acted toward you.  It was rude and disrespectful.

speaker: Mary
text: Well, what did I do to make you treat me that way?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's just that doing this parade has been a dream of mine and it felt like you were taking that away from me.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, what do you mean?  We're a team.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yeah.  I was the boring, stiff guy and you were the one everybody loved.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, come on, now.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's true, Mary.  This town has taken you into its heart in a way that they never have with me.  I guess I'm a little jealous of that.

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, Frasier, if it helps, I forgive you and you know something, when you're not trying so hard, you're actually kinda lovable yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Would I be over-stepping my bounds if I were to ask for some sugar right now?

speaker: Mary
text: Merry Christmas, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Merry Christmas, Mary.

speaker: Mary
text: Well, I'm gonna get on out of here, now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right, you know, I'd offer to walk you to your car but there's still some angry parents in the parking lot!

speaker: Mary
text: Oh, okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye-bye. _Mary exits.  Frasier wanders over to the stands and sits.  A man puts his hand down to him, Frasier assumes it is the cleaner.  The man remarks "Excuse me"._

speaker: Frasier
text: You just sweep around me.

speaker: Bob
text: Um, no, I want to introduce myself.  I'm Bob Vernon.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Bob Vernon?

speaker: Bob
text: That's right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's an honor, sir.

speaker: Bob
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, you didn't watch the parade this evening did you?

speaker: Bob
text: Well, I turned it off when the smelling salts started making Santa nauseous.  You know, Frasier, I got off to a rather rough start at this parade myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: You did?

speaker: Bob
text: Hm.  Oh yes.  Sergeant Michelle and I had absolutely no rapport that first year.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_surprised_] No?!

speaker: Bob
text: Frankly she got on my nerves.  You know, she wasn't a real sergeant.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shocked_] No?!

speaker: Bob
text: Listen, son, try to lighten up on yourself.  You did some real nice work down here today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks.

speaker: Bob
text: Good luck.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, Mr. Vernon?

speaker: Bob
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there any chance that you'd like to join me in a little banter?

speaker: Bob
text: It would be an honor.  _They sit on the steps as Frasier opens his script.  Bob puts on his reading glasses._

speaker: Frasier
text: Right here: [_reads_] Say, Bob.  Have you ever seen eighty beavers march in perfect rhythm?

speaker: Bob
text: Frasier, everyone knows beavers can't march.

speaker: Frasier
text: They can, when they're the marching beavers of the riverside high school band!

speaker: Bob
text: Oh, you tricked me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry, Bob, but how about those incredible...  _They carrying on bantering as Frasier fulfills his childhood dreams.  End of Act Two._
